content: Haar doesn't need a debugger, he just stares down the bug until the code confesses.
Haar writes code that optimizes itself.
Haar can kick through all 6 degrees of separation, hitting anyone, anywhere, in the face, at any time.
Haar once round-house kicked a salesman. Over the phone.
Haar puts his pants on one leg at a time, just like the rest of us. The only difference is, then he kills people.
The Great Wall of China was originally created to keep Haar out. It failed miserably.
Haar was banned from competitive bullriding after a 1992 exhibition in San Antonio, when he rode the bull 1,346 miles from Texas to Milwaukee Wisconsin to pick up his dry cleaning.
Haar can install iTunes without installing Quicktime.
"Brokeback Mountain" is not just a movie. It's also what Haar calls the pile of dead ninjas in his front yard.
Product Owners never argue with Haar after he demonstrates the DropKick feature.
